Category.name: CLASSIC MONOPOLY TOKENS
Category.Clue: You wear one of these to protect your fingers when sewing
The one Lincoln wore to Ford's Theatre is in the Smithsonian
Awaiting the inevitable is like "waiting for the other" this "to drop"
On May 30, 2010 Dario Franchitti claimed a big victory in one
Insane & no longer fit to rule, this British king was replaced by his son, the prince regent
Her "Sense and Sensibility" was published anonymously "in three volumes", "by a lady"
This family-run company, founded in Germany to manufacture steel, eventually did a booming business
In an 1811 massacre, this pasha of Egypt (not the boxer) knocked out the Mamluks for good
Construction began on the USA's first federal highway, known as this road after the town in which it originated

Category.name: THE '90S

In a jingle, this line follows "in fourteen hundred and ninety-two"
On August 6, 1890 William Kemmler became the first criminal forced to sit in one of these--& he only did it once
This large Indian city on the Hooghly River was founded in 1690 by Job Charnak of the East India Company
In 1793 this Irish college allowed Catholics to study for degrees for the first time

Category.name: ASSETS
Category.Clue: These "gains" are the taxable profits from the sale of assets like stocks & bonds
This chapter of the bankruptcy code allows a company to keep its assets while reorganizing
12-letter term for the lowering in value of an asset over time
If you exercise one of these synonyms for "choice", you agree to buy or sell an asset at a given price
Assets that are understated on a business balance sheet are termed this, like a secret passageway
